basic.floral_language:
Helianthus annuus
Floriogrphy: sunny, warm, and optimistic.

The name sunflower may derive from the fact that shape of the flower's head resembles the sun, or from the false impression that the blooming plant appears to slowly turn its flower towards the sun as the latter moves across the sky on a daily basis. Generally, there is only a single large golden inflorescence atop an unbranched stem like a small sun. The outer flowers, ray flowers, attract pollinators. The tubiform florets in the center of the flower head, disk flowers, mature into edible fruits (sunflower seeds).

Sunflower prefers sunny areas. The flower can grow in any season, however, summer and winter are better. Blooming period is short, lasting for two through three weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowers year around, viewing period 2-3 weeks
basic.color: Flower color golden yellow , mixed color

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, put in sunny places
maintenance.watering: Moderately resistant to drought, keep soil moist, water every 1-2 days in summer, once 3-6 days in autumn and winter
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, every 10-15 days apply fertilizers once
maintenance.pruning: Remove yellowing leaves and withered flowers timely
